document_data.name: Yusef al-Wadi
document_data.mainbody: Sultan '''Yusef bin Ahmad al-Wadi''', also called '''Yusef the Just''', was the ruler of [[Gana]] in the [[Pearl Cities]] region of [[west Zakhara]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Personality: Yusef's wisdom and knowledge with regard to the law earned him his nickname "Yusef the Just."
document_data.Activities: Yusef discouraged any one individual from holding power for too long, resulting in a relatively steady influx of talented individuals passing through the court of Gana.
document_data.Relationships: The sultan never married but did keep an active ''harim''. He had several children but did not formally recognized any of them which seemed disrespectful to some Ganites.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: The sultan was rumored to have once proposed marriage to his Chief Vizier [[Al'ia bint Hazir]].
